name: Skirmishers (The Empire)
special_rules:
Skirmisher stands are not independent units. Instead, a stand of Skirmishers can be added to any unit of Halberdiers, Handgunners or Crossbowmen to make 4-stand units (3 plus the Skirmisher stand).


	Skirmisher stands have the same Armor value as the rest of their unit, either 6+ or 0.


	Skirmisher stands fight as part of their units and can be chosen to be removed as casualties the same as other stands.


	Skirmisher stands do not count as losses for the purposes of Command penalties.


	Skirmisher stands do not count as part of the unit's formation when determining whether the unit is in a regular or irregular formation.
used_by: Halberdiers (The Empire), Handgunners (The Empire), Crossbowmen (The Empire)

name: Griffon (The Empire)
special_rules:
Griffons can be ridden by any characters in the army.


	Griffons can fly, increasing their riders' movement to 100cm.


	Griffons cause units they join to cause Terror.
used_by: General (The Empire), Hero (The Empire), Wizard (The Empire)

name: War Alter (The Empire)
special_rules:
An Empire army, no matter how large, can have no more than one War Alter.


	A War Alter can only be ridden by a Wizard.


	A War Alter can give +1 to the D6 rolled when casting a spell once per the battle. The player must announce that they are using this ability before rolling.

name: Zombie Dragon (Tomb Kings)
special_rules:
Zombie Dragons can be ridden by any characters in the army.


	Zombie Dragons can fly, increasing their rider's move to 100cm.


	Zombie Dragons cause units they join to cause Terror.


	Zombie Dragons have a fire breath shooting attack with 3 Attacks and a 20cm range that can only be used when joined with a unit and not in combat.
used_by: Tomb King (Tomb Kings), Liche Priest (Tomb Kings)

name: Liche Chariot (Tomb Kings)
special_rules: Liche Chariots can be ridden by any characters in the army.
used_by: Tomb King (Tomb Kings), Liche Priest (Tomb Kings)

name: Chaos Dragon (Chaos)
special_rules:
Chaos Dragons can be ridden by any characters in the army.


	Chaos Dragons can fly, increasing the move of their riders from 60 to 100cm.


	Chaos Dragons cause units they join to cause Terror.


	Chaos Dragons have a fire breath shooting attack with 3 Attacks and a 20cm range that can only be used when joined with a unit and not in combat.

name: Wyvern (Orcs)
special_rules:
Wyverns can be ridden by any characters in the army.


	Wyverns can fly, increasing the move of their riders to 100cm.


	Wyverns cause units they join to cause Terror.
used_by: Orc General (Orcs), Orc Hero (Orcs), Orc Shaman (Orcs), Goblin Hero (Orcs), Goblin Shaman (Orcs)

name: Chariot (Orcs)
special_rules: Charios can be ridden by any characters in the army.
used_by: Orc General (Orcs), Orc Hero (Orcs), Orc Shaman (Orcs), Goblin Hero (Orcs), Goblin Shaman (Orcs)

name: Giant Eagle (High Elves)
special_rules:
Giant Eagles can be ridden by any characters in the army.\n\n
	Giant Eagles can fly, increasing the move of their riders to 100cm.
used_by: General (High Elves), Hero (High Elves), Wizard (High Elves)

name: Dragon (High Elves)
special_rules:
Dragons can be ridden by any characters in the army.


	Dragons can fly, increasing the move of their riders to 100cm.


	Dragons cause units they join to cause Terror.


	Dragons have a fire breath shooting attack with 3 Attacks and a 20cm range that hits on 4+. It can only be used when joined with a unit and not in combat.
used_by: General (High Elves), Hero (High Elves), Wizard (High Elves)

name: Chariot (High Elves)
special_rules: Chariots can be ridden by any characters in the army.
used_by: General (High Elves), Hero (High Elves), Wizard (High Elves)

name: Anvil (Dwarfs)
special_rules:
A Dwarf army, no matter how large, can have no more than one Anvil.


	Only a Runesmith can equip an Anvil.


	The Runesmith can strike the Anvil during their Shooting phase. On 4+ all Dwarf units within 20cm of the Runesmith are immune to Terror for the rest of the Dwarf player's turn.


	Once per battle the Runesmith with the Anvil can get +1 to their D6 roll when attempting to dispel an enemy spell.

name: Salamanders (Lizardmen)
special_rules:
Salamander stands are not independent units. Instead one stand of Salamanders can be added to any Skink infantry units to make 4-stand units (3 plus the Salamander stand).


	Salamander stands fight as part of their units and can be chosen to be removed as casualties the same as other stands.


	Salamander stands do not count as lossses for the purposes of Command penalties.


	Salamander stands do not count as part of their unit's formation when determining whether the unit is in a regular or irregular formation.


	Salamander stands attached to Skink units give their whole unit, including the Salamander, the Salamander Venom shooting attack.


	The Salamander Vemon shooting attack has 2 Attacks with a 15 cm range and a -1 Armor penalty that can be fired 360 degrees. Against chargers it has only 1 Attack.

name: Stegadon (Lizardmen)
special_rules:
Stegadon mounts can only be ridden by the Slaan Mage Priest.\n\n
	Stegadons cause units they join to cause Terror.

name: Carnosaur (Lizardmen)
special_rules:
Carnosaurs can only be ridden by Saurus Heroes.\n\n
	Carnosaurs cause units they join to cause Terror.

name: Unicorn (Bretonnia)
special_rules:
Unicorns can only be ridden by an Enchantress.\n\n
	Unicorns can give +1 to the Enchantress' roll to cast a spell once per battle. The player must announce that they are using the this ability before rolling to cast the spell.

name: Pegasus (Bretonnia)
special_rules:
Pegasi can be ridden by any characters in the army.\n\n
	Pegasi can fly, increasing the move of their riders to 100cm.

name: Hippogriff (Bretonnia)
special_rules:
Hippogriffs can only be ridden by the General.\n\n
	Hippogriffs can fly, increasing the move of their riders to 100cm.

name: Grail Reliquae (Bretonnia)
special_rules:
A Bretonnian army, no matter how large, can have no more than one Grail Reliquae.


	Only a unit of Peasants can have the Grail Relique. This unit and all units of Peasants touching it are Grail Pilgrims for as long as they keep contact. Check if Peasants are Grail Pilgrims before taking an action with them.


	Grail Pilgrims are immune to Terror.


	Grail Pilgrims get a +1 Attacks bonus but keep the the restriction that they get no +1 Attacks for charging in the open.


	Grail Pilgrims must attack by initiative.


	Grail Pilgrims cannot be driven back or confused.

name: Bear (Kislev)
used_by:
Bears can be ridden by any characters in the army.\n\n
	General (Kislev), Hero (Kislev), Shaman (Kislev)

name: Yozhin (Kislev)
special_rules:
Only a single Shaman in the army can be assisted by Yozhin.


	The Shaman assisted by Yozhin can go into water/bog/swamp terrain witout restriction.


	The Shaman assisted by Yozhin causes Terror.

name: Tzarina (Kislev)
special_rules:
Only the General can be the Tzarina.


	The Tzarina can cast spells as a Wizard and can have a magic item restricted to Wizards.


	The Tzarina can give +1 to the D6 rolled when casting a spell once per battle. The player must announce that this ability is being used before rolling to cast the spell.

name: Manticore (Dark Elves)
special_rules:
Manticores can be ridden by any characters in the army.


	Manticores can fly, increasing the move of their riders to 100cm.


	Manticores cause units they join to cause Terror.
used_by: General (Dark Elves), Hero (Dark Elves), Sorceress (Dark Elves)

name: Chariot (Dark Elves)
used_by:
Chariots can be ridden by any characters in the army.\n\n
	General (Dark Elves), Hero (Dark Elves), Sorceress (Dark Elves)

name: Cauldron of Blood (Dark Elves)
special_rules:
A Dark Elf army, no matter how large, can have no more than one Cauldron of Blood.


	A Dark Elf army cannot have a Cauldron of Blood unless it has at least one unit of Witch Elves.


	The Cauldron of Blood can only be ridden/equipped by a Sorceress.


	The Sorceress with the Cauldron of Blood has a move of 30cm.


	The Cauldron of Blood can be used to give +1 to the Sorceress' roll to cast a spell once per battle. The player must announce that this ability is being used before rolling to cast the spell.

name: Demonic Wings (Demons)
special_rules:
Demonic Wings can be given to any characters in the army.\n\n
	Characters with Demonic Wings can fly.
used_by: Demon Overlord (Demons), Demon Lord Hero (Demons), Demonic Wings (Demons)

name: Favor of the Gods (Demons)
special_rules:
Favor of the Gods can given to any characters in the army.\n\n
	Characters with Favor of the Gods cause Terror.
used_by: Demon Overlord (Demons), Demon Lord Hero (Demons), Demonic Wings (Demons)

name: Flying Carpet (Araby)
special_rules:
Flying Carpets can be ridden by any characters in the army.\n\n
	Flying Carpets can fly, increasing the move of their riders to 100cm.

name: Elephant (Araby)
special_rules:
Elephants can be ridden by any characters in the army.


	Characters riding Elephants cannot join units of cavalry.


	Elephants cause units they join to cause Terror.

name: Djinn (Araby)
special_rules:
Djinns can only accompany Wizards.


	Djinns can fly, increasing the move of the Wizard they accompany to 100cm.


	Djinns give +1 to rolls to cast the Curse of the Djinn spell.


	Djinns cause units they join to cause Terror.


	Djinns' +2 shooting attacks only apply when they have joined units.

name: Winged Nightmare (Vampire Counts)
special_rules:
Winged Nightmares can be ridden by any characters in the army.


	Winged Nightmares can fly, increasing the move of their riders to 100cm.


	Winged Nightmares cause units they join to cause Terror.
used_by: Vampire Lord (Vampire Counts), Vampire (Vampire Counts), Necromancer (Vampire Counts)

name: Black Coach (Vampire Counts)
special_rules:
Black Coaches can only be ridden by Vampires and the Vampire Lord.\n\n
	Black Coaches cause units they join to cause Terror.

name: Griffon (Dogs of War)
special_rules:
Griffons can be ridden by any characters in the army.


	Griffons can fly, increasing the move of their riders to 100cm.


	Griffons cause units they join to cause Terror.
used_by: General (Dogs of War), Hero (Dogs of War), Paymaster (Dogs of War), Wizard (Dogs of War)

name: Pay Wagon (Dogs of War)
special_rules:
Pay Wagons can only be ridden by a Pay Master.\n\n
	A Paymaster with a Pay Wagon can add +1 to all of their Command checks for a single turn only.

name: Bull Rhinox (Ogre Kingdoms)
special_rules:
Bull Rhinoxes can be ridden by any characters in the army.\n\n
	Bull Rhinoxes cause units they join to cause Terror.
used_by: Tyrant (Ogre Kingdoms), Bruiser (Ogre Kingdoms), Butcher (Ogre Kingdoms)

name: Giant Eagle (Albion)
special_rules:
Giant Eagles can only be ridden by Druids.\n\n
	Giant Eagles can fly, increasing the move of their riders to 100cm.

name: Chariot (Albion)
special_rules: Charios can be ridden by any characters in the army.

name: Wolf Chariot (Goblins)
special_rules: Wolf Chariots can be ridden by any characters in the army.
used_by: Goblin Warboss (Goblins), Goblin Hero (Goblins), Goblin Shaman (Goblins)

name: Wyvern (Goblins)
special_rules:
Wyverns can fly, increasing the move of their riders to 100cm.\n\n
	Wyverns cause units they join to cause Terror.
used_by: Goblin Warboss (Goblins), Goblin Hero (Goblins), Goblin Shaman (Goblins)

name: Warhounds (Witch Hunters)
special_rules:
Warhound stands are not independent units. Instead, a stand of Warhounds can be added to any unit of Zealots, Handgunners, Pistoliers or Flagellants to make 4-stand units (3 plus the Warhound stand).


	Warhounds move up to 30cm.


	Warhounds can pursue enemy cavalry along with their unit if joined with Pistoliers.


	Warhound stands fight as part of their units and can be chosen to be removed as casualties the same as other stands.


	Warhound stands do not count as losses for the purposes of Command penalties.


	Warhound stands do not count as part of the unit's formation when determining whether the unit is in a regular or irregular formation.
used_by: Zealots (Witch Hunters), Handgunners (Witch Hunters), Pistoliers (Witch Hunters), Flagellants (Witch Hunters)

name: Great Taurus (Chaos Dwarfs)
special_rules:
Great Tauruses can be ridden by any characters in the army.


	Great Tauruses can fly, increasing the move of their riders to 100cm.


	Great Tauruses cause units they join to cause Terror.


	Great Tauruses have a shooting attack with a range of 20cm that can only be used when joined with a unit.
used_by: General (Chaos Dwarfs), Hero (Chaos Dwarfs), Sorcerer (Chaos Dwarfs)

name: Lammasu (Chaos Dwarfs)
special_rules:
Lammasus can only be ridded by Sorcerers.


	Lammasus can fly, increading the rider's move to 100cm.


	Hostile spells cast on units joined by Lammasus can be dispelled on a roll of 4+.

name: Sorcerer Lord (Chaos Dwarfs)
special_rules:
Only the General can be a Sorcerer Lord.


	A Sorcerer Lord can cast spells as a Wizard and can have a magic item restricted to either Generals or Wizards.


	Sorcerer Lords can give +1 to their roll to cast a spell once per battle. The player must announce that this ability is being used before rolling to cast the spell.

name: Wardancers (Wood Elves)
special_rules:
Wardancer stands are not independent units. Instead, a stand of Wardancers can be added to any unit of Eternal Guard or Glade Guard to make 4-stand units (3 plus the Wardancer stand).


	Wardancer stands have the same Armor value as the rest of their unit, either 5+ or 0.


	Wardancer stands fight as part of their units and can be chosen to be removed as casualties the same as other stands.


	Wardancer stands do not count as losses for the purposes of Command penalties.


	Wardancer stands do not count as part of the unit's formation when determining whether the unit is in a regular or irregular formation.
used_by: Glade Guard (Wood Elves), Eternal Guard (Wood Elves)

name: Giant Stag (Wood Elves)
special_rules: Giant Stags can only be ridden by Nobles, Spellweavers and the General.
used_by: General (Wood Elves), Noble (Wood Elves), Spellweaver (Wood Elves)

name: Unicorn (Wood Elves)
special_rules:
A Wood Elf Army, no matter how large, can have no more than one Unicorn.


	Unicorns can only be ridden by Spellweavers.


	Unicorns can add +1 to the Spellweaver's roll to cast a spell once per battle. The player must announce that they are using the this ability before rolling to cast the spell.

name: Warhawk (Wood Elves)
special_rules:
Warhawks can only be ridden by Nobles, Spellweavers and the General.\n\n
	Warhawks can fly, increasing the move of their riders to 100cm.
used_by: General (Wood Elves), Noble (Wood Elves), Spellweaver (Wood Elves)

name: Forest Dragon (Wood Elves)
special_rules:
Forest Dragons can only be ridden by Nobles, Spellweavers and the General.


	Forest Dragons can fly, increasing the move of their riders to 100cm


	Forest Dragons cause units they join to cause Terror.


	Forest Dragons have a corrosive breath shooting attack that has 3 Attacks at 20cm. It can only be used with the Forst Dragon is joined with a unit.
used_by: General (Wood Elves), Noble (Wood Elves), Spellweaver (Wood Elves)

name: Tuskgor Chariot (Beastmen)
special_rules: Tuskgor Chariots can only be ridden by Beastlords and Wargors.

name: Were Kin (Norse)
special_rules:
Any character in the army can be Were Kin.


	No terrain restrictions apply to Were Kin.


	Were Kin cause units they join to cause Terror.

name: Horn of Resounding (Norse)
special_rules:
Only a single Shaman in the army can ride this chariot.\n\n
	The Horn of Resounding allows the Shaman to summon and command Valkyrie units.
